The Ministry has been working with partners to meet the challenges from cultural and economic point of view. 
"Empowering women has pivotal role in national development. Based on Article 35 of the Federal Constitution the rights of women are also included in other packages," she said. 
Noting that the nation has registered good result in attaining MDGs, Ferenesh said that the Ministry would do its level best address the challenges. She also indicated the role of SMEs in improving the living conditions of women and their contribution to realizing the nation's middle income economy vision. 
ECCSA President Solomon Afework on his part said that economic empowerment of women is still at an infant stage. Even if women represent 50 per cent of the population, 63 per cent of them have no tangible role in the economic development of the country, due to educational, cultural and huge social responsibilities, he said. 
"Researches indicate that raising women participation in education as well as job opportunities could make 1.9 per cent contribution to the GDP. Accordingly, women in the private and public sector are expected to work together for better results." 
Written BY MENGISTEAB TESHOMME
